layer.name: Causality
layer.definition: The relationship between cause and effect; understanding that actions produce consequences and current states result from prior causes.

questions.text: I understand that my current spiritual state is largely the accumulated result of my past spiritual choices.
I recognize that habitual sin doesn't appear overnight — it grows from seeds I planted and watered.
I can see that people who are spiritually mature got there through specific practices over time — not special grace unavailable to me.
I understand that 'sowing to the Spirit' (Galatians 6:8) means specific actions that produce specific spiritual results.
questions.principle: Biblical sowing/reaping is concrete, not metaphorical

questions.text: I recognize that asking God to change my spiritual state without changing my spiritual inputs is asking for magic, not faith.
questions.principle: Faith cooperates with causality; it doesn't bypass it
